summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General (OIG) voluntary interview waiver form. It informs an employee that they are being asked to provide information as part of an OIG investigation, that the interview is voluntary, and outlines the warnings and assurances regarding the use of their statements. The specific subject of the investigation is redacted.
keyFacts: The document is a voluntary interview waiver form from the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG).
It states an OIG investigation is being conducted, but the specific subject of the investigation is redacted in the text.
The form outlines that the interview is voluntary, no disciplinary action will be taken for refusing to answer, but any statements provided may be used in future criminal or disciplinary proceedings.
The form includes signature lines for an OIG Special Agent and the employee being interviewed, but no names are filled in or visible in the provided text.
The document's primary function is procedural, to obtain a waiver from an employee before a voluntary OIG interview.
